definitions: the quality of a characteristic being transmissible from parent to offspring

examples.text: their study explored the heritability of children's IQ in different populations

shortDefinitions: quality of characteristic being transmissible from parent to offspring

definitions: the proportion of variability within a population that can be attributed to inherited genetic factors as opposed to environmental ones

examples.text: a feature such as eye color will have nearly 100 percent heritability
somewhat higher heritabilities were found in a subsequent study combining twins reared apart and together

shortDefinitions: proportion of variability that can be attributed to inherited genetic factors

definitions: the quality of being able to be inherited by heirs-at-law

examples.text: changes in the heritability of property rights have important implications for markets

shortDefinitions: quality of being able to be inherited by heirs-at-law
